fields.request: Manual QA: Confirm status.sh handles service names that look like flags
fields.request_details:
1. Configure a system install whose service name starts with dashes (for example create locks/service.lck containing `--control`).
2. Ensure systemd unit files exist for the service, celery worker, beat and LCD timers when applicable (e.g. `--control.service`).
3. Run `./status.sh` and confirm it no longer prints `grep: unrecognized option` errors when evaluating the guard timer and service states.
4. Verify the script correctly reports the service status, celery worker/beat states and LCD status without requiring any manual edits.
5. Document any anomalies in the Release Manager notes if the script still fails with dash-prefixed service names.
